docs.summary:
Provides functionality for elements that can be scrolled into and out
 of view.

srcDocs.summary:
Provides functionality for elements that can be scrolled into and out
 of view.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element enters the viewport.
params.srcDoc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element enters the viewport.

ret.doc: The element on which the event is now registered.
ret.srcDoc: The element on which the event is now registered.

docs.summary:
Adds an event handler that runs when an element is scrolled
 into the viewable part of the current window.
description: An element enters the viewport when the page is scrolled to show any
part of the element. An element enters the viewport even if it is hidden

examples.title: Get the ID of the element that has entered the viewport

srcDocs.summary:
Adds an event handler that runs when an element is displayed
 in the viewable part of the current window.
description: An element enters the viewport when the page is scrolled to show any
part of the element. An element also enters the viewport if it was
and is then shown or expanded in the viewable part of the current window.

examples.title: Get the ID of the element that has entered the viewport

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element leaves the viewport.
params.srcDoc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element leaves the viewport.

ret.doc: The element on which the event is now registered.
ret.srcDoc: The element on which the event is now registered.

docs.summary:
Adds an event handler that runs when an element is scrolled
 out of the viewable part of the current window.
description: An element leaves the viewport when the page is scrolled so that the
elements is completely out of view. An element leaves the viewport even
if it is hidden or collapsed.

examples.title: Get the ID of the element that has entered the viewport

srcDocs.summary:
Adds an event handler that runs when an element is no longer
 displayed in the viewable part of the current window.
description: An element leaves the viewport when the page is scrolled so that the
elements is completely out of view. An element also leaves the viewport
if it was shown or expanded and is then [hidden]($w.HiddenMixin.html#hidden)

examples.title: Get the ID of the element that has entered the viewport
